description.compact: The number of servers to replicate a change to before returning success. Inherited by instances of MongoCollection derived from this. w functionality is only available in version 1.5.1+ of the MongoDB server and 1.0.8+ of the driver.

docblock.description: The number of servers to replicate a change to before returning success. Inherited by instances of MongoCollection derived from this. w functionality is only available in version 1.5.1+ of the MongoDB server and 1.0.8+ of the driver.

description.compact: The number of milliseconds to wait for MongoDB::$w replications to take place. Inherited by instances of MongoCollection derived from this. w functionality is only available in version 1.5.1+ of the MongoDB server and 1.0.8+ of the driver.

docblock.description: The number of milliseconds to wait for MongoDB::$w replications to take place. Inherited by instances of MongoCollection derived from this. w functionality is only available in version 1.5.1+ of the MongoDB server and 1.0.8+ of the driver.

description.compact: Log in to this database

docblock.description: This method causes its connection to be authenticated. If authentication is enabled for the database server (it's not, by default), you need to log in before the database will allow you to do anything.

description.compact: Execute a database command

docblock.description: Almost everything that is not a CRUD operation can be done with a database command. Need to know the database version? There's a command for that. Need to do aggregation? There's a command for that. Need to turn up logging? You get the idea.

description.compact: Creates a new database

docblock.description: This method is not meant to be called directly. The preferred way to create an instance of MongoDB is through MongoClient::__get or MongoClient::selectDB.

description.compact: Creates a collection
Creates a database reference
Drops this database

docblock.description: This drops the database currently being used.

description.compact: Drops a collection [deprecated]
Runs JavaScript code on the database server [deprecated]

docblock.description: The eval command, which this method invokes, is deprecated in MongoDB 3.0+.

description.compact: Creates a database error

docblock.description: This method is not very useful for normal MongoDB use. It forces a database error to occur. This means that MongoDB::lastError will return a generic database error after running this command.

description.compact: Gets a collection
Returns information about collections in this database
Gets an array of names for all collections in this database
Fetches the document pointed to by a database reference
Fetches toolkit for dealing with files stored in this database
Gets this database's profiling level

docblock.description: This returns the current database profiling level.

description.compact: Get the read preference for this database
Get slaveOkay setting for this database
Get the write concern for this database
Check if there was an error on the most recent db operation performed
Gets an array of MongoCollection objects for all collections in this database
Checks for the last error thrown during a database operation
Repairs and compacts this database

docblock.description: This creates a fresh copy of all database data. It will remove any corrupt data and compact and large stretches of free space it finds. This is a very slow operation on a large database.

description.compact: Clears any flagged errors on the database

docblock.description: This method is not used in normal operations. It resets the database error tracker (which can be incremented with MongoDB::forceError, also not normally used).

description.compact: Gets a collection
Sets this database's profiling level

docblock.description: This changes the current database profiling level.

description.compact: Set the read preference for this database
Change slaveOkay setting for this database
Set the write concern for this database
The name of this database
